entry.title: Richard Childress Racing Museum (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Richard Childress Racing Museum (exhibition pictured) is located in the former team workshop in which Richard Childress Racing won six NASCAR Cup Series championships and 58 races?

entry.title: Samuele Parlati (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in February 2023, Italian footballer Samuele Parlati saved a penalty kick while playing as an emergency goalkeeper?

entry.title: The Beautiful Letdown (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that songs in The Beautiful Letdown are "chunky", "gentle", and "nois[y]"?

entry.title: Battle of Corycus (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Romans used grappling hooks during the Battle of Corycus to board Seleucid ships?

entry.title: Guillaume Diop (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Paris Opera Ballet dancer Guillaume Diop co-authored a manifesto that called for the Paris Opera to make urgent changes to address racial discrimination?

entry.title: The White Lotus was nominated (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that at the 2022 Primetime Emmy Awards The White Lotus was nominated in five categories and won in all?

entry.title: Abbas ibn Abi al-Futuh (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Abbas ibn Abi al-Futuh was a Zirid prince who became a vizier of the Fatimid Caliphate after assassinating his stepfather, and was overthrown after murdering caliph al-Zafir?

entry.title: a 100-room hotel on the Moon (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in 1967 Hilton Hotels revealed plans for a 100-room hotel on the Moon?
